chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin X Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession Of A Firearm By Adjudicated Deliquent, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(bm).
  • Receiving Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Resisting An Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered that mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and victim witness surcharge, assessments are to be collected by DOC at maximum rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.
Court waived nonmandatory court cost due to defendant's inability to pay.\
-Restitution and fine set at $0.00.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2, 3 and 4.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin X Ford

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING (6 pages) commencing 07-28-22 by BENJAMIN LOKKEN.
Counts two, three and four.
Count one.
received and filed
received and filed
received and filed
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed
received and filed

Defendant Austin X Ford in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Austin X Ford in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.   

AS TO COUNT 1, 2, 3 AND 4.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 46 MONTHS, concurrent to COUNT 2, 3 and 4 with credit for 171 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 16 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 30 MONTHS. 

AS TO COUNT 2.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 1, 3 and 4, with credit for 171 days served. 

AS TO COUNT 3.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 1, 2 and 4, with credit for 171 days served. 

AS TO COUNT 4.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 1, 2 and 3, with credit for 171 days served. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Court waived non-manditory court cost due to defendant's inability to pay.
-Court ordered that manditory court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) assessments are to be collected by DOC at MAXIMUM rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution and fine set at $0.00.

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment.
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Received and Filed.  nk

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Austin X Ford not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rakestraw is unavailable on 7/20/2022 for the plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defense counsel contacted court to inform he is unable to appear on June 24 and requested adjournment.
Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via electronic mail.
Case is adjourned for plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2022.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Austin X Ford not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Defense counsel advises Court that there is pending revocation as to defendant.  
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Austin X Ford in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Austin X Ford in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer C. Crivello.   Court took judicial notice of Waukesha case 21CF1272 and Milwaukee case 14JV2991A. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Austin X Ford in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Austin X Ford in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Austin X Ford appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.    Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
